subject: Re: Individual Product Suggestions
preview: Logged 15 mins to Harvest for hearingyou.net.au

full_threads.body: Logged 15 mins to Harvest for hearingyou.net.au

action.text: Joel Maligalig assigned to Heath Maguire
Joel Maligalig assigned to Joel Maligalig

full_threads.body:
Hi Heath,
Thank you for amending this change, however its still not clear to the end user that all is needed is a $250 refundable deposit to proceed, and remainder to be paid at fitting. Can we please make this clearer and more prominent perhaps on the home page in the 4 step process (under fit and pay).
After your payment of a $250 refundable deposit, we invite you to one of the many Northside Audiology clinics for your fitting. An Audiologist will fit and tune your device(s). The balance of the payment is made at the completion of the appointment, all major credit cards accepted. We provide a 60 day trial period, and all manufacturer warranties apply.

Under the Hearing loss FAQ's please rename this to FAQ.

In the cart section can we do the following?
Instead of subtotal put total cost. instead of total put deposit payable now and add another row saying balance due at fitting


Thanks

Steve


On Wed, 25 Nov 2020 at 14:49, Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>> wrote:
Hi All,

Confirming we have made the below update now re the pricing.

Thanks and speak soon,
Heath Maguire
CREATIVE DIRECTOR

>> On 24 Nov 2020, at 4:27 pm, <home@reinhardts.net <mailto:home@reinhardts.net>> <home@reinhardts.net <mailto:home@reinhardts.net>> wrote:
>>
>> Hello Heath
>> I think the website is vastly improved, but there is a huge flaw in the process once you add an aid to the cart.
>> When you add to the cart, it does not show the price, nor a sub total.
>
>> If you scroll down, it asks for a $250 deposit but there is no explanation of how and when the balance is due.
>> I believe that anyone getting this far would leave the site at this point as it so poorly explained.
> *Please provide the explanation and we will happily add it to the cart page.
>
>> Also, at the foot of the payment page the banner “Find your perfect hearing aid “ appears, with the three options, “Know what you need? ”Not sure what you need?” “Take an on line hearing test” I think this banner should not appear on the payment page, it would only make sense to have a “contact us “button at this point.
> *Removed.
>
>> On the payment page we need to show clearly that the deposit is $250 per aid, what the balance owing is and advise customers that the final payment will be requested at the fitting appointment( I am assuming the deposit is $250 per aid, Steven, is this correct?)
> *Steven please confirm and we will updated accordingly.
>
>> It would be good to remind them on the payment page that they do get a 60 day trial period with a full refund if they are not satisfied.
> *This is already there.
>>
>>
>>
>> Kind regards,
>>
>> Jeffrey Reinhardt
>>
>> home@reinhardts.net <mailto:home@reinhardts.net>
>> M +61 0414 953 311
